Define Documentation

#define Define_Channel ( CLASSNAME   ) 

Announces the C++ channel class to OMNeT++, and couples it with the NED channel declaration of the same name.

#define Define_Channel_Like ( CLASSNAME,
NEDNAME   ) 

Announces the C++ channel class to OMNeT++, and couples it with the NED channel declaration of the given name.

This macro has been previously marked as deprecated, and was removed in OMNeT++ 4.0.

#define Define_Function ( NAME,
ARGCOUNT   ) 

Registers a C/C++ mathematical function for use in NED and ini files.

The function may take 0, 1, 2 or 3 double arguments, and must return a double. Corresponding C/C++ typedefs: MathFuncNoArg, MathFunc1Arg, MathFunc2Args, MathFunc3Args, MathFunc4Args.

Commonly used <math.h> functions have Define_Function() lines in the OMNeT++ simulation kernel.

See also:
Define_NED_Function

#define Define_Function2 ( NAME,
FUNCTION,
ARGCOUNT   ) 

Like Define_Function(), but takes three arguments, the second one being the pointer to the function.

This macro allows registering a function with a different name from its implementation.

#define Define_Function3 ( NAME,
ARGCOUNT,
CATEGORY,
DESCRIPTION   ) 

Like Define_Function(), but takes category and description strings as well.

#define Define_Function4 ( NAME,
FUNCTION,
ARGCOUNT,
CATEGORY,
DESCRIPTION   ) 

Like Define_Function2(), but takes category and description strings as well.

#define Define_Module ( CLASSNAME   ) 

Announces the C++ simple module class to OMNeT++, and couples it with the NED simple module declaration of the same name.

#define Define_Module_Like ( CLASSNAME,
NEDNAME   ) 

Announces the C++ simple module class to OMNeT++, and couples it with the NED simple module declaration of the given name.

This macro has been previously marked as deprecated, and was removed in OMNeT++ 4.0.

#define Define_NED_Function ( FUNCTION,
SIGNATURE   ) 

Registers a C/C++ function for use in NED and ini files; see cNEDFunction.

FUNCTION is a pointer to the function, and SIGNATURE is the function's signature in NED.

The C++ function should have the following signature: 

Value f(cComponent *context, Value argv[], int argc)
where Value stands for cDynamicExpression::Value.

SIGNATURE is a string with the following syntax: 

returntype name(argtype argname,...)
where types can be bool, long, double, quantity, string, xml, any (where quantity is a double with a unit of measurement); names of optional args should end in '?'.

Example: 

 Define_NED_Function(uniformFunc,"quantity uniform(quantity a, quantity b, long rng?)")

#define Define_NED_Function2 ( FUNCTION,
SIGNATURE,
CATEGORY,
DESCRIPTION   ) 

Like Define_NED_Function(), but allows one to specify a category string and documentation as well.

#define Module_Class_Members ( CLASSNAME,
BASECLASS,
STACK   ) 

This macro has been previously marked as deprecated, and was removed in OMNeT++ 4.0.

Existing occurrences should be replaced with a public default constructor. That is,

 Module_Class_Members(Foo, cSimpleModule, 0)

should become

 public:
   Foo() : cSimpleModule() {}

#define Register_Class ( CLASSNAME   ) 

Register class.

This defines a factory object which makes it possible to create an object by the passing class name to the createOne() function. The class must be a subclass of cObject, otherwise a compile-time error will occur: "cannot convert..."

#define Register_ClassDescriptor ( DESCRIPTORCLASS   ) 

Internal.

Registers a class descriptor which provides reflection information.
